events.message: The customer reported a severe car collision that took place on the highway during rush hour and filed the claim promptly.
After reviewing the initial report, the claim was categorised under Auto Accident due to the involvement of the customer's vehicle.
An insurance agent was assigned to manage the customer's auto accident claim and coordinate the following steps.
The customer received acknowledgement of the claim filing, including details on the claim process and expected timeline.
Request sent to the customer for supporting documents such as the vehicle registration, accident report, and photos of the damage.
The customer submitted all the requested documents, including police reports and repair estimates from the auto shop.
An investigation into the circumstances of the car accident was initiated to verify all submitted information and claims.
The investigation confirmed the validity of the claim and assessed the extent of the vehicle damage and liability.
A settlement proposal was sent to the customer outlining the compensation amount based on the repair costs and policy limits.
The customer responded positively to the settlement proposal and expressed satisfaction with the prompt handling of the case.
The claim was officially approved following agreement on the settlement terms and positive feedback from the customer.
Payment for the approved settlement was issued to the customer to cover repair costs for the damaged vehicle.
The auto accident claim was officially closed after final payment was made and the customer confirmed all matters resolved.
The case files and documents related to the customer's car accident claim were archived for future reference and compliance.
